intro: Boechera gracilenta, commonly known as slender rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Boechera gracilenta is also known for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
